data.title: Markdown Preview only is display on the part of workspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. When I use  **VSCode** for **Preview function of Markdown** , as the picture shows, the result of Preview only is display on **the part of workspace**. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15683489/20519200/f4c32318-b0dc-11e6-99e3-ba07b5d9fe81.png)
This is my “**Workspace settings**“. Because I just install VSCode and install "Instant Markdown" and "Markdown Theme Kit" plug-in. Beside, I try to reinstall VSCode and remove ".vscode" folder in current user directory.It likes water off a duck's back.
```
{
    // "markdown.styles": [
    //     ""
    // ]
    "window.zoomLevel": 1
}
```
2. I have use **Debugger for Chrome** plugin for a demo project which only include a html file. There exist some errors.
This is showed in the **console of Chrome**.
```
>Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED
>Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
```
This is showed in the **console of VSCode**.
```
Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:9222).

Verbose logs are written to C:\Users\tlm\.vscode\extensions\msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome-2.2.2\vscode-chrome-debug.txt
OS: win32 ia32
Adapter node: v6.5.0 ia32
vscode-chrome-debug-core: 3.6.3
debugger-for-chrome: 2.2.1
spawn('C:\Users\tlm\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe', ["--remote-debugging-port=9222","--no-first-run","--no-default-browser-check","http://localhost:8080"])
Discovering targets via http://127.0.0.1:9222/json
HTTP GET failed: Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:9222
Discovering targets via http://127.0.0.1:9222/json
```
But It is no error When I try to use **IIS Express** to run the project. 

Ps:
     I use **Windows 10** and the version of **Nodejs** is v6.9.1 which the version of **npm** is 3.10.8.

data.title: git bash displays wrong input characters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set git bash as default terminal:
    File -> Preferences -> User Settings, add 
        "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe"
    at settings.json.
2. Open git bash by Ctrl + `.
3. Type some characters wrapped with ""

Expected:
 "123123123123"
Result: 
"12312"3123"123"

data.title: Javascript React Emmet is not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open up a `.jsx` file
2. Pressing tab now no longer autocomplete `jsx` syntaxes.

Did I miss something on the changelog? I just updated it and suddenly it stops working. Running with `--disable-extension` still does not fix the problem. Apparently no issue about this has been raised in here so I'm quite confused right now whether it's an intended change or a local problem. Thanks.

#### Edit

`vscode@1.6.1` does not have this problem.

data.title: Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly
C_Cpp.clang_format_style: IndentWidth is invaild
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.1
- OS Version:windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install c/c++ plugins
2. edit settings.json

`
{
    "C_Cpp.clang_format_style": "{BasedOnStyle: Google, IndentWidth: 4}"
}`

but c/c++ code indentwidth always display 2

data.title: switch out of search menu without mouse?
data.body: Is there a way to switch between search menu and file explorer without mouse? I'm used to cmd+shift+f -> search stuff -> esc to quit the search menu from Atom, Sublime.

data.title: Diff Doesn't Show Changes for New Line Characters
data.body:
Initialize a new Git repo, commit a file with some text. Change the line endings to something else and save. It will show that the file was modified but will not show the lines that have changed.

![change](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8701667/20514769/ef5baad4-b05b-11e6-8617-0778f85b596f.png)

data.title: Not able to find modules/types for tsx files after recent updates.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows
- Typescript version: 2.0.6
Steps to Reproduce:

1. We have a project for which VS code was working perfectly fine ( before some updates). Here is the tsconfig.json ( this is there just to support vscode, we a separate build system)
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "module": "amd",
        "target": "es5",
        "jsx": "react"

    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules"
    ]

}
```

The project structure looks something like this

```
Foo/**
VSS/
        @types/**
         .....
tsconfig.json
```
VSS folder here is a hard link. 

2. I have two files in Foo i.e Temp.ts and Temp1.tsx . 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1177554/20514131/4edf4656-b0b0-11e6-9953-787cebe64954.png)

Any hints on resolving this ? I can help you with more info if required. I cannot share the code since this is Microsoft Internal (VSTS), but we can have a skype session if you want.

Also any hints on debugging this on my own ?

data.title: Hash for backup should produce same result for different path casing
data.body: On case insensitive file systems (Windows, Mac), the backup hash function should produce the same result independent from the case of the path. I suggest to lowercase on those OS to make sure.

data.title: Directory navigation feature
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04
  Is there any faster way to navigate the directory tree? I am working on a project with around 300 node_modules and everytime I need to search for one of the node_modules i need to expand the node_modules directory and manually scroll all the way to the required module. As my project goes on increasing this becomes more and more of a pain. Can there be a way to search a directory the way it works in Intellij? i.e. we focus on the directory tree and type the name of the directory we want to go to and intellij searches for and takes us to the corresponding directory. 
P.S I am aware of the `Ctrl+P` command which opens a file, but that doesn't seem to work so well with directories

data.title: Cannot undo last commit in git viewlet?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:14:18.217Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-26-generic

Follow [smoke test](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test), I can't seem to undo the commit I just made?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/20510982/38a907dc-b029-11e6-8115-21c36afd279a.png)

Here's the commit:

```
commit 05bca0601a672da37ff4e01214b36b0d92ab89a7
Author: Daniel Imms <daimms@microsoft.com>
Date:   Mon Nov 21 20:25:02 2016 -0800

    asd

diff --git a/.gitignore b/.gitignore
index 40b878d..0ec3bf9 100644
--- a/.gitignore
+++ b/.gitignore
@@ -1 +1 @@
-node_modules/
\ No newline at end of file
+node_modules/asdasdasda
\ No newline at end of file
```

I undid that commit and tried another one (that wasn't changing node_modules in .gitignore) and it didn't allow me again:

```
commit 08183a918ed62e2768fe122b98d937f07f21a2a5
Author: Daniel Imms <daimms@microsoft.com>
Date:   Mon Nov 21 20:30:37 2016 -0800

    asdasd

diff --git a/.vscode/launch.json b/.vscode/launch.json
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..c502190
--- /dev/null
+++ b/.vscode/launch.json
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+{
+    // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible Node.js debug attributes.
+    // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
+    // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
+    "version": "0.2.0",
+    "configurations": [
+        {
+            "type": "node",
+            "request": "launch",
+            "name": "Launch Program",
+            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bin/www",
+            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
+        },
+        {
+            "type": "node",
+            "request": "attach",
+            "name": "Attach to Process",
+            "port": 5858
+        }
+    ]
+}
\ No newline at end of file
```

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:

After dragging a file from right to left tab well, the tab scrollbar moves all the way to the left. any further attempts to scroll back to the right will fail, as the scrollbar has taken on a life of its own.

data.title: Allow to drop a folder from outside into the explorer to copy it
data.body:

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14931

Currently, the behavior is that VSCode will open the folder in the workspace, no matter where you drag it. But sometimes, you want to copy a folder into the current workspace.

data.title: auto type acquisition doesn't kick in without --save
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14931

Steps to Reproduce:
1. remove `underscore` from `%localappdata%/TypeScript/package.json` and from corresponding `node_modules`
2. open a Node project that does not have `underscore` installed (e.g. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express.git). VSCode will subsequently install type-registry, and any `@types` associated with the project. 
3. `npm install underscore`

Expected: underscore is installed, as are associated types, even though it doesn't exist in package.json
Actual: types are not installed

Note that reloading the project altogether yields the expected behavior.
